metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14100 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Asterisk 11.x before 11.25.2, 13.x before 13.17.1, and 14.x before14.6.1 and Certified Asterisk 11.x before 11.6-cert17 and 13.x before13.13-cert5, unauthorized command execution is possible. The app_minivmmodule has an "externnotify" program configuration option that is executedby the MinivmNotify dialplan application. The application uses thecaller-id name and number as part of a built string passed to the OS shellfor interpretation and execution. Since the caller-id name and number cancome from an untrusted source, a crafted caller-id name or number allows anarbitrary shell command injection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14100` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-config - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mobile - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-modules - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-mysql - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-tests - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
asterisk-vpb - 1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:13.17.1~dfsg-1ubuntu1').
